verses.verse: Maschil <S%H4905><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> hast thou cast us off <S%H2186><s%> forever? <S%H5331><s%> why doth thine anger <S%H639><s%> smoke <S%H6225><s%> against the sheep <S%H6629><s%> of thy pasture? <S%H4830><s%>

Remember <S%H2142><s%> thy congregation, <S%H5712><s%> which thou hast purchased <S%H7069><s%> of old; <S%H6924><s%> the rod <S%H7626><s%> of thine inheritance, <S%H5159><s%> which thou hast redeemed; <S%H1350><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> mount <S%H2022><s%> Zion, <S%H6726><s%> wherein thou hast dwelt. <S%H7931><s%>

Lift up <S%H7311><s%> thy feet <S%H6471><s%> unto the perpetual <S%H5331><s%> desolations; <S%H4876><s%> even all <S%H3605><s%> that the enemy <S%H341><s%> hath done wickedly <S%H7489><s%> in the sanctuary. <S%H6944><s%>
Thine enemies <S%H6887><s%> roar <S%H7580><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of thy congregations; <S%H4150><s%> they set up <S%H7760><s%> their ensigns <S%H226><s%> for signs. <S%H226><s%>
A man was famous <S%H3045><s%> according as he had lifted up <S%H935><s%> <S%H4605><s%> axes <S%H7134><s%> upon the thick <S%H5442><s%> trees. <S%H6086><s%>
But now <S%H6258><s%> they break down <S%H1986><s%> the carved work <S%H6603><s%> thereof at once <S%H3162><s%> with axes <S%H3781><s%> and hammers. <S%H3597><s%>

They have cast <S%H7971><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> into thy sanctuary, <S%H4720><s%> they have defiled <S%H2490><s%> by casting down the dwelling place <S%H4908><s%> of thy name <S%H8034><s%> to the ground. <S%H776><s%>

They said <S%H559><s%> in their hearts, <S%H3820><s%> Let us destroy <S%H3238><s%> them together: <S%H3162><s%> they have burned up <S%H8313><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the synagogues <S%H4150><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> in the land. <S%H776><s%>

We see <S%H7200><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> our signs: <S%H226><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> any prophet: <S%H5030><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> is there among <S%H854><s%> us any that knoweth <S%H3045><s%> how long. <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4100><s%>

O God, <S%H430><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> shall the adversary <S%H6862><s%> reproach? <S%H2778><s%> shall the enemy <S%H341><s%> blaspheme <S%H5006><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> forever? <S%H5331><s%>
Why <S%H4100><s%> withdrawest <S%H7725><s%> thou thy hand, <S%H3027><s%> even thy right hand? <S%H3225><s%> pluck <S%H3615><s%> it out of <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7130><s%> thy bosom. <S%H2436><s%>
For God <S%H430><s%> is my King <S%H4428><s%> of old, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6924><s%> working <S%H6466><s%> salvation <S%H3444><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>

Thou <S%H859><s%> didst divide <S%H6565><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> by thy strength: <S%H5797><s%> thou didst break <S%H7665><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of the dragons <S%H8577><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the waters. <S%H4325><s%>

Thou <S%H859><s%> didst break <S%H7533><s%> the heads <S%H7218><s%> of leviathan <S%H3882><s%> in pieces, and gavest <S%H5414><s%> him to be meat <S%H3978><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%> inhabiting the wilderness. <S%H6728><s%>
Thou <S%H859><s%> didst cleave <S%H1234><s%> the fountain <S%H4599><s%> and the flood: <S%H5158><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> driedst up <S%H3001><s%> mighty <S%H386><s%> rivers. <S%H5104><s%>
The day <S%H3117><s%> is thine, the night <S%H3915><s%> also <S%H637><s%> is thine: thou <S%H859><s%> hast prepared <S%H3559><s%> the light <S%H3974><s%> and the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Thou <S%H859><s%> hast set <S%H5324><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the borders <S%H1367><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> hast made <S%H3335><s%> summer <S%H7019><s%> and winter. <S%H2779><s%>

Remember <S%H2142><s%> this, <S%H2063><s%> that the enemy <S%H341><s%> hath reproached, <S%H2778><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and that the foolish <S%H5036><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> have blasphemed <S%H5006><s%> thy name. <S%H8034><s%>

O deliver <S%H5414><s%> not <S%H408><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of thy turtledove <S%H8449><s%> unto the multitude <S%H2416><s%> of the wicked: forget <S%H7911><s%> not <S%H408><s%> the congregation <S%H2416><s%> of thy poor <S%H6041><s%> forever. <S%H5331><s%>

Have respect <S%H5027><s%> unto the covenant: <S%H1285><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the dark places <S%H4285><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of the habitations <S%H4999><s%> of cruelty. <S%H2555><s%>
O let not <S%H408><s%> the oppressed <S%H1790><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> ashamed: <S%H3637><s%> let the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> thy name. <S%H8034><s%>

Arise, <S%H6965><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> plead thine own cause: <S%H7378><s%> <S%H7379><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> how <S%H4480><s%> the foolish man <S%H5036><s%> reproacheth <S%H2781><s%> thee daily. <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%>

Forget <S%H7911><s%> not <S%H408><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of thine enemies: <S%H6887><s%> the tumult <S%H7588><s%> of those that rise up against <S%H6965><s%> thee increaseth <S%H5927><s%> continually. <S%H8548><s%>
